abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Primary Education Upgrading Project in
            Cape Verde. The overall objectives of PREBA were to provide
            the policy and institutional framework together with the
            necessary educational inputs for establishing an integrated
            six-year basic education system (EBI), as well improving
            education sector management. The outcome of the project was
            highly satisfactory. It exceeded its major objectives. The
            chances of sustainability are relatively high. Lessons for
            the future include: (i) Careful attention must be given to
            designing and setting up the project management and
            coordination capacity in a country to ensure successful
            implementation and a realistic timetable set for attaining
            institutional reform objectives. (ii) Complex project
            management arrangements do not work well in the absence of a
            high degree of internal coordination within a ministry that
            is undergoing institutional restructuring itself (iii)
            Simultaneous externally financed projects to strengthen
            institutional capacity run the risk of overtaxing the
            agency's managerial resources, without there being
            greater institutional and coordination capacity already in
            place. (iv) Financial accounting systems must be established
            and be operational at credit effectiveness. (v) Supervision
            must be adequate, timely, and well-focused.
